root: ^Don Quixote: Greetings adventurer. My name is sir knight Don Quixote, may I take your name please.
^Kindly tell me your title again sir?!

c-0: ^Don Quixote: Nice to meet you, honorable B.F. Are you a fellow knight like me?
^You: Why tell me what you are again, kind sir?
^Don Quixote: Keep up with the times, my dear fellow. A knighthood is an incredibly honorable profession.

c-1: ^You: Why tell me what you are again, kind sir?
^Don Quixote: Keep up with the times, my dear fellow. A knighthood is an incredibly honorable profession.
^Don Quixote: Now tell me what is your title?

c-0: ^Don Quixote: Ah, a pleb. No worries, you are in luck. You can learn a lot from me.

g-0: ^Don Quixote: Tell me B.F., have you seen a man named Sancho, Sancho Panza. Not very bright, certainly not as suave as me, but the man has gotten his charms. All that is to say, my dear B.F., have you seen him？

c-3: ^You: You might want to tell me what Sancho looks like.
^Don Quixote: Sure thing my fella man, honest looking, but obviously not as good looking as me.

c-0: ^Don Quixote: A knightly move. Thank you B.F.
c-1: ^You: It saddens me to say I have not seen this man before. He is probably left behind.
^Don Quixote: Valiant effort in logical deduction. I, however, will keep on looking for him.
g-0: ^What were you doing before you got here?

c-2: ^You: What were you doing before getting here?
^Don Quixote: Getting beamed up to here, through a magical force set forth by a wicked mage. I’ll find out who is responsible. I wage this on my honor.

c-0: ^Don Quixote: I was closely observing a weird beam from the sky.
^Don Quixote: I was approaching a beam from the sky from afar.
^Don Quixote: I heard a loud noise, sounding like a beam coming from the sky, and was deliberating wheather to investigate such anomaly or not.
^You: Before any of the beam business please!!!
^Don Quixote: Being an exemplar knight of course. With my trusty companion Sancho Panza. Who is not here.
